adminEmail.subject: Wp-Pro-Quiz: One user completed a quiz
adminEmail.message:
Wp-Pro-Quiz
The user "$username" has completed "$quizname" the quiz.
Points: $points Result: $result

userEmail.subject: Wp-Pro-Quiz: One user completed a quiz
userEmail.message:
Wp-Pro-Quiz
You have completed the quiz "$quizname".
Points: $points Result: $result

question.title: Question: 1
question.questionText: The A320/A321 aircraft is divided into zones as follows:

answer.answerText: The major zones, the major sub-zones, the zones
The zones and sub-zones.
The zones and the station.
The major zones, the major sub-zones

question.title: Question: 2
question.questionText: Each major zone is identified by:

answer.answerText: Three digit number and two letters
Three digit number
The first digit of three digit number

question.title: Question: 3
question.questionText: Access doors and panels are identified by:

answer.answerText: The number of the zone in which the panel is located followed by a two-letter suffix.
The number of the zone in which the panel is located followed by one letter suffix.
a two-letter followed by the number of the zone in which the panel is located suffix.

question.title: Question: 4
question.questionText: There are how many major zones in the aircraft?

question.title: Question: 5
question.questionText: The Tail Safety stay is used to:

answer.answerText: Share load with the main jacks during jacking process
Keep the aircraft more stable during landing gear retraction/ extension tests
Keep the aircraft stable on jacks

question.title: Question: 6
question.questionText: How many points on the structure are designated for the purpose of lifting the aircraft?

question.title: Question: 7
question.questionText: What is permissible during jacking for main LDG wheel change?

answer.answerText: Cargo, PAX loading.
Gate docking.
Installation of the wheel chocks on the wheels of the other main LDG.

question.title: Question: 8
question.questionText: The main purpose of weighing aircraft is:

answer.answerText: Calculate the position of the center of gravity
Calculate of aircraft weight
Know the aircraft weight for passenger loading

question.title: Question: 9
question.questionText: When Lifting the AIRCRAFT for leveling

answer.answerText: You must not lift the aircraft with the safety stay.
The weight of fuel is applied equally on the two side of the aircraft centerline
Make sure that the aircraft is stable before you lift it with jacks
All above

question.title: Question: 10
question.questionText: When Lifting the aircraft

answer.answerText: All the doors must be closed and locked
Passenger/crew door may be fully opened and locked but the cargo doors must be closed and locked
The passenger/crew doors, the emergency exits and the cargo doors are closed and locked or fully open and locked
No requirement.

question.title: Question: 11
question.questionText: When the NLG dimension H is more than 300 mm

answer.answerText: Do not tow the aircraft to prevent damage to the centering cams.
Do not tow the aircraft to prevent tail to ground contact.
Smooth and speed limited towing is possible.

question.title: Question: 12
question.questionText: If a engine is running

answer.answerText: You can tow the aircraft from the front only.
You can push the aircraft only.
Either tow or push is possible.

question.title: Question: 13
question.questionText: Towing the aircraft is

answer.answerText: Allowed with one engine running above idle.
Allowed with both engines running up to idle.
Allowed only with one engine running up to idle.

question.title: Question: 14
question.questionText: Towing can be carried out with

answer.answerText: Passenger/crew doors fully open and locked without restriction.
Cargo doors open in vertical position with speed limited
Engine cowls open and hold open rods fully locked

question.title: Question: 15
question.questionText: Towing can be carried out using

answer.answerText: Tow bar or towbarless tractor at NLG.
Tow bar or towbarless tractor at MLG(s)
Tow bar at NLG only.

question.title: Question: 16
question.questionText: The maximum permitted steering-angle on each side of the aircraft centerline is

answer.answerText: 95 degrees.
75 degrees.
74 degrees

question.title: Question: 17
question.questionText: What is the correct sequence?

answer.answerText: Install the tow bar on the tow fitting then install the tow lever safety pin
Install the tow lever safety pin then install the tow bar on the tow fitting.
There is no specific sequence

question.title: Question: 18
question.questionText: Communication system(s) to be used during towing is (are)?

answer.answerText: VHF and FLT INT.
VHF or HF with FLT INT.
VHF only.

question.title: Question: 19
question.questionText: What indication on ECAM do you have to check prior to start towing?

answer.answerText: N WHEEL STEERG DISC
N WHEEL STEERG INOP
N WHEEL STEERG OFF

question.title: Question: 20
question.questionText: From cockpit how can you know that the brake are release prior to towing the aircraft?

answer.answerText: Check Parking brake selector in OFF, brake pressure indication on ECAM is at 0 and confirm with GND personnel.
Check Parking brake selector in OFF; check all the 03 pointes are at green range and confirm with GND personnel.
Check Parking brake selector in OFF; brake pressure pointes at 0 and confirm with GND personnel.

question.title: Question: 21
question.questionText: Minimum separation from the nose wheels and the tractor while towing the aircraft is:

answer.answerText: 2 m

question.title: Question: 22
question.questionText: In towing configurations the safety pin locks the control lever on the interphone box in:

answer.answerText: Disengaged position.
Engaged position.
Normal position.

question.title: Question: 23
question.questionText: When towing the aircraft:

answer.answerText: All the doors must be closed and locked
Passenger/crew door may be fully opened and locked the cargo doors open in vertical position
Passenger/crew door may be fully opened and locked but the cargo doors must be closed and locked

question.title: Question: 24
question.questionText: When you do the Aircraft Grounding for the Refuel/Defuel Operations

answer.answerText: Connect the ground cable to parking ground point before you connect it to the aircraft
Attach the cable to aircraft first then connect to parking ground point
Grounding is not necessary

question.title: Question: 25
question.questionText: To electrostatically balance the aircraft for the refuel/defuel operations

answer.answerText: Connect a ground cable to the aircraft grounding point on the landing gears
Connect a bonding cable between the fuel tanker and a grounding point on one of the MLG Legs
A is essential, B is recommended
B is essential, A is recommended

question.title: Question: 26
question.questionText: Safety requirements for aircraft Refuelling and defuelling are:

answer.answerText: Do not operate the cell phones or mobile phones inside distances for 6m from aircraft.
Do not connect electrical equipment to a power source less than 15 m away from aircraft, unless the power source has spark-proof connectors
Do not operate the fuel tanker/pump unit until you stop operation of the weather radar
All above

question.title: Question: 27
question.questionText: During aircraft Refuelling or defuelling

answer.answerText: APU starts or shutdowns are permitted
An APU start is not permitted during if the APU has failed to start or an automatic shutdown has occurred
A & B

question.title: Question: 28
question.questionText: During the refuelling

answer.answerText: The NLG tires roll aft
The NLG tires roll fwd
The NLG tires roll does not move

question.title: Question: 29
question.questionText: During the refuelling you must:

answer.answerText: Move the aft NLG chocks away from the tires
Make sure that the chocks do not touch the MLG tires
A & B

question.title: Question: 30
question.questionText: When you do the Refuelling and/or defuelling in the Hangar

answer.answerText: The hangar doors must be closed until you have completed the refuel/defuel procedure
The hangar doors must not be closed until you have completed the refuel/defuel procedure
There is no requirement for hangar door

question.title: Question: 31
question.questionText: When you do the aircraft pressure Automatic refueling with battery power

answer.answerText: It is not always possible to refuel to full capacity. This is because the intercell transfer valve are not always in the correct position
It is always possible to refuel to full capacity.
You can not refuel in the outer cell.

question.title: Question: 32
question.questionText: The maximum safety pressure for refueling is:

answer.answerText: 45psi
50psi
55psi
60psi

question.title: Question: 33
question.questionText: When you do the aircraft refueling with battery power

answer.answerText: The HOT BUSS is energized for ten minutes only after you put the BATT POWER switch to the ON position.
HOT BUSS is always energized after you put the BATT POWER switch to the ON position.
You must put the BATT POWER switch to the ON position and hold it during refueling process

question.title: Question: 34
question.questionText: When you do the aircraft pressure refueling with manual control

answer.answerText: Put the MODE SELECT switch to the REFUEL position
Put the REFUEL VALVES switch(es) for the applicable fuel tank(s) to the OPEN position and for the tank(s) which will not be refuelled to the SHUT position.
Put the REFUEL VALVES switch(es) of all the fuel tank(s) to the OPEN position
A & B

question.title: Question: 35
question.questionText: The aircraft configuration requirements for filling the hydraulic fluid reservoir are:

answer.answerText: The FWD, AFT cargo-compartment doors and the landing gear doors are closed
The FWD, AFT cargo-compartment doors and the landing gear doors are opened
The FWD, AFT cargo-compartment doors are closed and the landing gear doors are opened
The FWD, AFT cargo-compartment doors are opened and the landing gear doors are closed

question.title: Question: 36
question.questionText: When doing the Hydraulic Fluid Reservoir Filling

answer.answerText: The hydraulic system operating normally
The reservoirs air pressurize system must be depressurized
Do not depressurize the system reservoirs
Green hydraulic system must be depressurized

question.title: Question: 37
question.questionText: What happen if you fill to much hydraulic fluid in the reservoir?

answer.answerText: Hydraulic system can not operate
A message "reservoir overfull" appear on ECAM
You cannot pressurize it the reservoir sufficiently and may cause the message "RSVR LO AIR PR" on ECAM.
Hydraulic fluid transfers to other reservoir.

question.title: Question: 38
question.questionText: When filling the hydraulic fluid Reservoir with a hydraulic service cart, the maximum supply pressure is:

question.title: Question: 39
question.questionText: If you think there are fuel fumes when you remove the oil filter cap of the engine oil tank.

answer.answerText: You must let the oil tank pressure bleed off for a minimum of 5 minutes before you remove the tank filler cap for oil servicing.
Add oil in the oil tank to full mark
Replace the fuel/oil heat exchanger then flush the engine oil system
Flush the oil tank and fill in with new oil.

question.title: Question: 40
question.questionText: When filling the hydraulic power accumulators with Nitrogen:

answer.answerText: All hydraulic systems must be depressurized
The reservoirs air pressurize system must be depressurized
Do not depressurize the hydraulic systems
Green hydraulic system must be depressurized

question.title: Question: 41
question.questionText: In the AMM tasks, “WARNING” is meant:

answer.answerText: Calls attention to use of materials, processes, methods, procedures or limits which must be followed precisely to avoid injury of death to persons
Calls attention to methods and procedures which be followed to avoid damage to equipment
Calls attention to methods which make the job easier or provide supplementary or explanatory information

question.title: Question: 42
question.questionText: In the AMM tasks, “CAUTION” is meant:

answer.answerText: Calls attention to use of materials, processes, methods, procedures or limits which must be followed precisely to avoid injury of death to persons
Calls attention to methods and procedures which be followed to avoid damage to equipment
Calls attention to methods which make the job easier or provide supplementary or explanatory information

question.title: Question: 43
question.questionText: In the AMM tasks, “NOTE” is meant:

answer.answerText: Calls attention to use of materials, processes, methods, procedures or limits which must be followed precisely to avoid injury of death to persons
Calls attention to methods and procedures which be followed to avoid damage to equipment
Calls attention to methods which make the job easier or provide supplementary or explanatory information

question.title: Question: 44
question.questionText: AMM gives:

answer.answerText: The status of the item of equipment, semi-equipment and related wiring
Information required for trouble shooting is contained in the manual
The information required to service, repair, replace, adjust, inspect and check equipments and systems of the A/C normally performed on the ramp or in the maintenance hangar
Schematic diagrams of the electrical installation with sufficient data for A/C fault isolation

question.title: Question: 45
question.questionText: What is the main purpose of the pack anti ice valve?

answer.answerText: To stop the ice formation across the primary heat exchanger.
To stop the ice formation across the main heat exchanger.
To stop the ice formation across pack condenser.

question.title: Question: 46
question.questionText: What is the purpose of the pack RAM AIR flaps?

answer.answerText: To ensure cabin ventilation in case both packs fail.
To provide air to the pack compressor.
To modulate the main air flow through the heat exchangers.

question.title: Question: 47
question.questionText: What flow is delivered by pack with Pack Flow selector on LO and bleed air supplied by the APU?

answer.answerText: Low
Normal
High

question.title: Question: 48
question.questionText: The purpose of the safety valves is to avoid :

answer.answerText: Excessive positive pressure differential
Excessive negative pressure differential
Excessive cabin altitude.
A and

question.title: Question: 49
question.questionText: When does the avionics ventilation air come from when any OVRD selected?

answer.answerText: From the avionics bay
From outside the aircraft
From the air conditioning duct
No ventilation. System is inoperative.

question.title: Question: 50
question.questionText: What is the purpose of the avionic ventilation skin heat exchanger?

answer.answerText: To cool the air coming from the avionics equipment when Isolation valve is open.
To reheat air coming from avionics ventilation system
To cool air before it is ducted under the cargo compartment.

question.title: Question: 51
question.questionText: Aircraft on ground, in order to communicate from the cockpit to the APU position, you must:

answer.answerText: Select the INT on the audio control panel, and press the “SERV INT” pushbutton
press “CAB” transmission key
press the “SERV INT” pushbutton
press “CAB” receiving knob

question.title: Question: 52
question.questionText: The loudspeaker volume knobs allow:

answer.answerText: Controls the loudness of aural alerts and voice messages
Controls the loudness of voice messages only
Adjusts the volume of the loudspeaker for radio communication
Adjusts the volume of the loudspeaker for radio communication , aural alerts and voice messages

question.title: Question: 53
question.questionText: Maintenance buses only are supplied when:

answer.answerText: External power is connected and blue ON light on EXT PWR pushbutton illuminated; MAIN BUS switch in ON position
External power is connected and the green AVAIL light on EXT PWR pushbutton illuminated; MAIN BUS switch is ON position
Any generator is coupled to the network; MAIN BUS switch is in ON position,
The APU generator or external power is connected; EXT PWR pushbutton illuminated; MAIN BUS switch in ON position

question.title: Question: 54
question.questionText: Both light “AVAIL” and “NOT IN USE” in the external power receptacle are illuminated when:

answer.answerText: An External Power Source is supplying the Aircraft Network
An External Power Source is supplying the Maintenance Bus Bars
At least one External Power Parameter is not correct, the External Power Contactor (EPC) stays Open
All External Power Parameters are correct but the EPC is Open

question.title: Question: 55
question.questionText: If a high APU generator oil temperature detection occurs:

answer.answerText: An immediate APU shut down is commanded and the APU Generator is denergized
The APU Generator is disconnected only
The APU Generator Fault Light illuminates only
A Warning Message is displayed on ECAM only

question.title: Question: 56
question.questionText: What does the EXT PWR PB “AVAIL” light illuminated on EXT PWR panel means?

answer.answerText: External power is plugged in,and all parameters are normal
All external power parameters are normal but not plugged in
External power is plugged in
External power is plugged in and supplied to A/C network

question.title: Question: 57
question.questionText: What is the output of APU generator?

answer.answerText: 90 KVA
50 KVA
5 KVA
1 KVA

question.title: Question: 58
question.questionText: Smoke hoods are supplied for the cabin attendants to:

answer.answerText: Supply oxygen for passengers.
Fight a fire or against emission of smoke or noxious gases.
Breathe oxygen.

question.title: Question: 59
question.questionText: Which device has to be unlocked before closing the slide window?

answer.answerText: A locking pin on the sliding window frame.
The sliding window operating handle.
None.

question.title: Question: 60
question.questionText: Which cabin panels are removable?

answer.answerText: Lower sidewall panels only.
All the panels.
Upper sidewall panels only.

question.title: Question: 61
question.questionText: Where are passenger oxygen masks stored?

answer.answerText: In the passenger service unit
In the seat arm rest
In the overhead stowage compartment

question.title: Question: 62
question.questionText: Captain and First Officer Seats are:

answer.answerText: Symmetrical and have the same function
Asymmetrical and have the same function
Have the same function and interchangeable.
Folding type and has no adjustment

question.title: Question: 63
question.questionText: Captain and First Officer Seats electrical control system permits

answer.answerText: Control the seats in vertical and horizontal direction
Control the seats in vertical and horizontal direction and adjust the backrest
Control the seats in vertical and horizontal direction and adjust the lumbar rest
All above

question.title: Question: 64
question.questionText: The A320 aircraft is fitted with emergency evacuation slide at:

answer.answerText: The 4 entry doors.
The overwing exits
The 4 entry doors and the overwing exits

question.title: Question: 65
question.questionText: Third Occupant seat in the cockpit

answer.answerText: Can slide along the Y-axis to take up a position on the aircraft centerline
Have longitudinal adjustment
Can moves longitudinally and vertically
Attached to the left rear panel in the cockpit

question.title: Question: 66
question.questionText: The passenger seats

answer.answerText: Seat pans are upholstered and not foldable or adjustable
Can fold the inner armrests between the backrests
Upholstered backrest assembly of each seat may be adjusted
All above

question.title: Question: 67
question.questionText: The Passenger Service/Information Units (PSIUs)

answer.answerText: Has two primary units: Passenger Service Unit (PSU) and Passenger Information Unit (PIU)
The Passenger Service Unit (PSU), installed above each seat row
The Passenger Information Unit (PIU), installed above each second seat row
All above

question.title: Question: 68
question.questionText: Where are the Engine fire detectors located?

answer.answerText: On the Fan and the Turbine and Pylon
On the Pylon, the Fan and the Core
On the Core, Gearbox and the Nozzle

question.title: Question: 69
question.questionText: Is the extinguishing system controlled by the FDU:

answer.answerText: Yes, continuously
Yes, whenever engine fire is detected
No

question.title: Question: 70
question.questionText: How is an APU fire on ground normally extinguished:

answer.answerText: From APU fire panel.
From APU compartment
Automatically.
From external power panel.

question.title: Question: 71
question.questionText: You press the APU shut off push button at 108VU panel to?

answer.answerText: Initiate the shut down the APU with cooling down sequence.
Initiate the emergency shut down of APU without cooling down sequence.
Initiate the emergency shut down of APU and discharge the APU fire bottle.

question.title: Question: 72
question.questionText: To test the APU auto extinguishing function, you must:

answer.answerText: Select APU master switch ON.
Press the APU fire TEST push button.
Select APU master switch ON and press the APU fire TEST push button.

question.title: Question: 73
question.questionText: What additional external warning is/ are activated in case of APU fire on GROUND?

answer.answerText: APU fire light & external horn warning.
A fire bell warning.
An external horn warning only.
An external horn warning & Red disk indicator disappears.

question.title: Question: 74
question.questionText: How many fire extinguishing bottle(s) is(are) provided for the cargo compartments?

answer.answerText: There’s one for FWD and one for AFT cargo compartment.
There’s one for both FWD and AFT cargo compartments.
None.

question.title: Question: 75
question.questionText: A pressure switch for each pump monitors a:

answer.answerText: Pressure differential
Feed pipe pressurization
Pressure increase
Loss of pressure

question.title: Question: 76
question.questionText: What happen if a high level is detected?

answer.answerText: A warning is triggered: too much fuel
Booster pumps are not operating correctly
The corresponding REFUEL valve closes
All the refueling operating is stopped

question.title: Question: 77
question.questionText: Are wing pumps running while center tank is supplying?

answer.answerText: Yes, wing tank pumps run continuously
No, only when center tank is empty
No, because of center tank pump priority
One of the two pumps is running in stand-by

question.title: Question: 78
question.questionText: When the center tank is empty, in auto mode, center tank pumps:

answer.answerText: Must be manually switched OFF
Stop and wing tank pumps start running
Stop automatically
Run for 2 minutes

question.title: Question: 79
question.questionText: Refuel valves may be controlled:

answer.answerText: By refuel pressure
Electrically only
Manually only
Electrically or manually

question.title: Question: 80
question.questionText: The APU fuel feed is assured by:

answer.answerText: Fuel booster pumps only
APU fuel pump only
All pumps together
A or

question.title: Question: 81
question.questionText: What is the maximum total fuel capacity for VNA’s A320 aircraft?

question.title: Question: 82
question.questionText: In normal operation, each engine is supplied by:

answer.answerText: One wing tank pump and/ or one center tank pump
Two wing tanks pumps and/ or one center tank pump
Two wing tanks pumps and/ or two center tank pumps
One wing tank pump and/ or two center tank pumps

question.title: Question: 83
question.questionText: During refueling, the wing tank fills in the following order:

answer.answerText: The Outer cell and Inner cell at the same time
The Inner cell first, then the Outer cell
The Outer cell first, then the Inner cell

question.title: Question: 84
question.questionText: The inner cell is refueled only when?

answer.answerText: Center tank is full.
Outer cell is full.
Outer cell is empty.

question.title: Question: 85
question.questionText: The maximum refuel pressure is?

answer.answerText: 11 psi
45 psi
50 psi

question.title: Question: 86
question.questionText: The END light in the refuel/defuel panel illuminate, means?

answer.answerText: Pre-selected fuel is equal to actual fuel.
All fuel tanks are full, refuel process stopped automatically.
Any high level sensor detected fuel.

question.title: Question: 87
question.questionText: When performing the refuel, defuel, Ground transfer, the R/D electrical circuit is enable by?

answer.answerText: Power from the aircraft electrical net work only.
Carrying out HI LVL test.
Contact R/D panel door switch.

question.title: Question: 88
question.questionText: In flight, if the blue electric pump fails the blue system:

answer.answerText: Is lost.
Can be recovered by the RAT.
Can be recovered by the PTU.
Both B and C

question.title: Question: 89
question.questionText: During first engine start the PTU is:

answer.answerText: Automatically running.
Tested
Inhibited

question.title: Question: 90
question.questionText: To which system(s) will the Ram Air Turbine provide hydraulic power?

answer.answerText: The blue system
The yellow system
The green and yellow systems
The blue and yellow systems

question.title: Question: 91
question.questionText: What happens if hydraulic pressure drops?

answer.answerText: The priority valves give priority to the heavy loads users.
The priority valves give priority to the essential systems
The priority valves modulate the pressure to the users

question.title: Question: 92
question.questionText: A Blue system pipeline is identified by:

answer.answerText: A blue band and number 1.
A blue band and number 2.
A blue band and number 3.

question.title: Question: 93
question.questionText: When is the engine fire shut off valve closed?

answer.answerText: When the engine is shut down
Automatically as soon as an engine fire is detected
If the engine fire pushbutton is release out.

question.title: Question: 94
question.questionText: What can the hand pump be used for?

answer.answerText: To pressurized the reservoir.
To check the flight controls
To operate the cargo doors

question.title: Question: 95
question.questionText: During which operation is the leak measurement valve closed automatically

answer.answerText: PTU operation.
Cargo door operation.
Hand pump operation.

question.title: Question: 96
question.questionText: What are the manual depressurization valves provided for?

answer.answerText: Individual reservoir depressurization
Depressurization of related hydraulic circuit
Hydraulic system depressurization

question.title: Question: 97
question.questionText: Hot air used for wing anti-iced is taken from?

answer.answerText: Aircraft pneumatic system.
Bleed from either engine 1 or 2.
Directly from the main engine compressors.

question.title: Question: 98
question.questionText: In the event of an engine anti-ice valve failure?

answer.answerText: Each valve can be deactivated in open position.
Each valve can be deactivated in close position.
Each valve can be deactivated either in close or open position.

question.title: Question: 99
question.questionText: When does the UNLK light come on?

answer.answerText: When the gear and the related doors are not locked up.
When the gear is not locked down.
When the gear is not locked in the selected position.

question.title: Question: 100
question.questionText: What is the normal retraction sequence?

answer.answerText: Door open, gear up, door close, cancel gear up signal
Door open, gear up, door close, maintain gear up signal.
Door open, gear up, door close, cancel door close signal.

question.title: Question: 101
question.questionText: How can the parking brake be hydraulically powered?

answer.answerText: Only by yellow high pressure
Only by the brake accumulator
Either by yellow high pressure or by the brake accumulator

question.title: Question: 102
question.questionText: What is the purpose of the hydraulic fuses?

answer.answerText: To stop the flow in case of leakage
To shut off the return lines
To separate the Normal from the Alternate Servovalve.

question.title: Question: 103
question.questionText: Which lighting includes fluorescent lamps and integral ballast units:

answer.answerText: Passenger reading lights and work attendant light
Cabin light, entrance light and lavatory lights
Lavatory lights sign
Emergency lights sign

question.title: Question: 104
question.questionText: The navigation lights include:

answer.answerText: RED light on the left hand, GREEN light on the right hand and WHITE light on the APU tail.
GREEN light on the left hand, RED light on the right hand and WHITE light on the APU tail.
WHITE light on the left hand, GREEN light on the right hand and RED light on the APU tail.
RED light on the left hand, WHITE light on the right hand and GREEN light on the APU tail.

question.title: Question: 105
question.questionText: An oxygen generator starts to make oxygen when:

answer.answerText: The panel is opened
The lanyard is pulled
The MAN OVRD pushbutton on the passenger oxygen control panel is operated
When the cabin pressure altitude is above 14.000ft.

question.title: Question: 106
question.questionText: How is the passenger chemical generator activated?

answer.answerText: By pushing the MASK MAN ON pushbutton.
As soon as the ALTITUDE PRESSURE SWITCH is closed
When the TIME DELAY RELAY is fully energized
By a release pin which is connected via a lanyard to the oxygen mask

question.title: Question: 107
question.questionText: The crew oxygen system consists of:

answer.answerText: A fixed high pressure cylinder.
A high pressure portable cylinder
A fixed cylinder with masks and a breathing hood system

question.title: Question: 108
question.questionText: Can the crew oxygen cylinder pressure be checked when there is no electrical power?

answer.answerText: Yes
No

question.title: Question: 109
question.questionText: 0.What indicates an overboard discharge?

answer.answerText: A warning on the oxygen control panel 21VU.
The direct reading pressure gauge on the oxygen cylinder.
A yellow indicator.

question.title: Question: 110
question.questionText: 1.At high engine speed the high pressure valve (HPV) is:

answer.answerText: Regulating a pressure
Fully closed
Fully open
Regulating a temperature

question.title: Question: 111
question.questionText: 2.Where the air is taken from during engine high power setting?

answer.answerText: IP stage.
HP stage.
IP and HP at the same time.

question.title: Question: 112
question.questionText: 3.What is the purpose of IP/HP switching?

answer.answerText: To regulate the output pressure depending on the Fan Air Valve position.
To keep sufficient bleed pressure at low engine speed
To regulate the output temperature depending on the configuration of users.

question.title: Question: 113
question.questionText: 4.The APU bleed valve is?

answer.answerText: A modulating valve.
An ON/OFF valve.
A and

question.title: Question: 114
question.questionText: 5.The APU bleed leak detection system is?

answer.answerText: A single loop that connects to BMC 1.
A single loop that connects to both BMC 1 and BMC 2.
The double loops that connect to BMC 1 and BMC 2 respectively.

question.title: Question: 115
question.questionText: 6.Which signal close the Fill/ Drain valve during servicing with electrical power available?

answer.answerText: By a quantity transmitter which sends a tank full signal to close the fill/drain valve automatically
When the quantity gauge indicates full the valve has to be closed manually
When the water comes out of the overflow port the valve has to be closed manually
There is no signal available, the tank has to be filled with a measured amount of water.

question.title: Question: 116
question.questionText: 7.How is the water tank depressurized during servicing?

answer.answerText: By waiting for the system pressure to dissipate
By operating a wash basin faucet
By operating the fill/over flow valve
By a push button the servicing panel

question.title: Question: 117
question.questionText: 8.Can any toilet be used during servicing?

answer.answerText: Yes, because toilet use and servicing is independent
Yes, but only the front toilet
Yes, but electric power is required to supply the toilet control system
No, the door limit switch on the toilet servicing panel deactivates the toilet control system.

question.title: Question: 118
question.questionText: 9.Is it possible to drain the whole water system without electrical power?

answer.answerText: No, electrical power is always required
Yes, all the drain valves can be operated manually
No, only the water tanks can be drained by using the aft drain valve
No, only the forward drain valve can be operated manually.

question.title: Question: 119
question.questionText: 0.Why is water tank pressurized?

answer.answerText: To ease draining operation.
To warm up water.
To allow water distribution.

question.title: Question: 120
question.questionText: 1.What is used for A320 aircraft water tank filling operation?

answer.answerText: One handle, one valve.
Two handles, one valve.
One handle, two valves.

question.title: Question: 121
question.questionText: 2.How many valves are used during draining operation of A320 aircraft water tank

answer.answerText: Two
Three
Four

question.title: Question: 122
question.questionText: 3.How many potable water service and drain panels are fitted to the A320 aircraft?

answer.answerText: One
Two
Three

question.title: Question: 123
question.questionText: 4.Where is the main drain port of the A320 aircraft potable water system?

answer.answerText: On the portable water service panel.
On the fwd service panel.
Both

question.title: Question: 124
question.questionText: 5.How many potable water quantity indicators are there?

answer.answerText: One
Two
Three

question.title: Question: 125
question.questionText: 6.How many quantity TRANSMITTER is in the potable water tank?

answer.answerText: One
Two
Three

question.title: Question: 126
question.questionText: 7.The waste water drain valve.

answer.answerText: Electrically operated
Is held closed in flight by cabin air pressure and open when waste water enters the valve has build up enough.
Open on ground and close in flight
Manually operated only by lifting the seal assembly.

question.title: Question: 127
question.questionText: 8.Where does the toilet bowl rinsing water come from?

answer.answerText: Waste holding tank.
Waste water tank.
Potable water tank.

question.title: Question: 128
question.questionText: 9.How is the waste transported to the waste holding tank?

answer.answerText: By the vacuum created in the waste holding tank.
By the water flushing and gravity.
By the water pressure

question.title: Question: 129
question.questionText: 0.How many toilet service panels are fitted on the aircraft?

answer.answerText: One
Two
Three

question.title: Question: 130
question.questionText: 1.How many potable water service and drain panels are fitted to the aircraft?

answer.answerText: One
Two
Three

question.title: Question: 131
question.questionText: 2.Where is the waste quantity displayed?

answer.answerText: On the toilet service panel
On the Forward Attendant Panel
On both panels.

question.title: Question: 132
question.questionText: 3.The E.C.B has?

answer.answerText: Restricted authority over APU operation.
Monitoring function over APU operation.
Full authority over APU operation.

question.title: Question: 133
question.questionText: 4.From where the APU emergency shut down can be initiated?

answer.answerText: Refuel/Defuel panel; External power panel and Cockpit.
External power panel and Cockpit only.
External power panel only, if the aircraft is on ground

question.title: Question: 134
question.questionText: 5.What indication can be displayed on the APU page?

answer.answerText: FLAP OPEN.
FUEL LO PR; LOW OIL LVL
FLAP OPEN; FUEL LO PR; LOW OIL LVL.

question.title: Question: 135
question.questionText: 6.What are the three APU modules?

answer.answerText: Compressor, Combustion chambers, Turbine.
Power section, Load Compressor, Turbine.
Power section, Load Compressor, Gearbox.

question.title: Question: 136
question.questionText: 7.The APU fuel low pressure circuit can be activated from?

answer.answerText: Cockpit and External Power Panel.
Cockpit and Fuel Vent system at APU compartment.
Cockpit; External Power Panel and Fuel Vent system at APU compartment.

question.title: Question: 137
question.questionText: 8.How can you activate the APU fuel vent system?

answer.answerText: Push and hold the VENT P/B at the APU compartment.
Select master switch ON.
Push and hold the VENT P/B with the master switch selected ON.

question.title: Question: 138
question.questionText: 9.How do you check the APU OIL quantity?

answer.answerText: On APU page, on sight glass located on the gear box and interrogate the CFDS.
On APU page, on sight glass located on the gear box.
On APU page, on sight glass located on the oil cooler and interrogate the CFDS.

question.title: Question: 139
question.questionText: 0.The high oil temperature or low oil pressure detected during APU operation, the ECB will cause the APU to shut down:

answer.answerText: Only if the MASTER switch is released
Only if the START pushbutton is released
Only after the cool down period has elapsed
Immediately

question.title: Question: 140
question.questionText: 1.During cooling down sequence at 75% N, the APU is:

answer.answerText: Still running without electrical and pneumatic load
Still running with electrical load
Wind milling without electrical and pneumatic load
Still running with electrical and pneumatic load

question.title: Question: 141
question.questionText: 2.The APU self test is performed from the MCDU. this function is available only:

answer.answerText: If the APU is running
If the APU is not running
Doing the APU start sequence
If the START pushbutton is pressed in

question.title: Question: 142
question.questionText: 3.What indicates the red flashing light on the cabin door?

answer.answerText: The escape slide will not deploy after automatic opening
The first bar has failed to engage into the floor fittings
The slide system is armed avoid the interior locking handle is partly lifted
Both engine shut down, door disarmed, the cabin pressure is greater than 2,5 mb

question.title: Question: 143
question.questionText: 4.How is the passenger door closed and locked information be monitored?

answer.answerText: By a single microswitch (lock position) on the "ECAM DOOR" page
By two proximity detection on the "ECAM DOOR" page
No indication at all
Landing gear control interface unit n° 1 (LGCIU 1) on the "ECAM DOOR" page

question.title: Question: 144
question.questionText: 5.What indicates the green light in the cargo door access?

answer.answerText: The cargo door is closed and locked
The cargo door is not closed
The cargo door is unlocked
The cargo door is open and locked

question.title: Question: 145
question.questionText: 6.What happen when the passenger door is opened from the outside and the slide system is armed?

answer.answerText: The locking mechanism is blocked
The escape slide will deploy
The slide system is disarmed
There is no possibility to open the door from the outside

question.title: Question: 146
question.questionText: 7.What happen when the emergency exit door of A320 aircraft is opened from the outside and the slide system is armed?

answer.answerText: The locking mechanism is blocked
The escape slide will deploy
The slide system is disarmed
There is no possibility to open the door from the outside

question.title: Question: 147
question.questionText: 8.The PAX door is maintained parallel to the fuselage by:

answer.answerText: The guide arms.
The support arms
The upper and lower connection links.

question.title: Question: 148
question.questionText: 9.How the operator is warned, when there is a residual pressure in the cabin?

answer.answerText: By a white flushing light.
By a red flushing light.
By an ember flushing light.

question.title: Question: 149
question.questionText: 0.What does the green light fitted near the manual selector valve of the cargo door indicate?

answer.answerText: The yellow hydraulic pressure is available to operate the door.
The door is fully opened and locked
The door is correctly unlatched and unlocked

question.title: Question: 150
question.questionText: 1.When can the cargo door be opened?

answer.answerText: When the cam and the hooks are in the locked position.
When the cam is in the unlocked position and the hooks are in the locked position
When the cam and the hooks are in the unlocked position

question.title: Question: 151
question.questionText: 2.The cargo doors hydraulic system is pressurized by the:

answer.answerText: Green electric pump
Blue electric pump
Yellow electric pump

question.title: Question: 152
question.questionText: 3.When does the residual cabin pressure red light come on?

answer.answerText: When all the engines are not running, the parking brake is applied and the residual cabin pressure exceeds 2.5 mbars
When the engines are not running, the slide is disarmed and the residual cabin pressure exceeds 2.5 mbars
When the engines are not running, the parking brake is applied, the slide is disarmed and the residual cabin pressure exceeds 2.5 mbars

question.title: Question: 153
question.questionText: 4.The seal of pax door:

answer.answerText: Is installed around the door on the inner side and when the door is closed, the it is pushed against the frame of the fuselage
Is installed around the door on the outer side and when the door is closed, the it is pushed against the frame of the fuselage
Is deflated when the door is closed and the passenger cabin is pressurized

question.title: Question: 154
question.questionText: 5.The air stoppers are installed between the PAX door and the door frame

answer.answerText: Prevent the cold air from penetrating into the cabin
Prevent the water comes into the cabin
Protect the door structure during operation.

question.title: Question: 155
question.questionText: 6.Emergency exit door of a320 aircraft:

answer.answerText: Can be opened from outside or/and inside and the door fall outside of aircraft.
Can be opened from outside or/and inside and the door fall into the cabin.
Can be opened from outside and the door fall outside of aircraft
Can be opened from inside and the door fall into the cabin,

question.title: Question: 156
question.questionText: 7.The pressurization of the cargo door hydraulic system does not occur when:

answer.answerText: The locking mechanism is in the locked condition.
The door not in fully close or/and open position.
The door not in fully open position.
The door is operated with hand pump

question.title: Question: 157
question.questionText: 8.BULK Cargo-Compartment Door is opened:

answer.answerText: Outward and upward
Outward and downward
Inward and upward
Inward and downward

question.title: Question: 158
question.questionText: 9.The FWD and AFT cargo doors:

answer.answerText: Possible to open/close at the same time
Possible to open at the same time when using the electric pump only
Possible to open one by one only
Possible to close at the same time only

question.title: Question: 159
question.questionText: 0.The external power receptacle

answer.answerText: Is installed in the lower and is a quick-opening type door and opens outwards towards the front of the aircraft
Is installed in the lower and is a quick-opening type door and opens outwards downwards the front of the aircraft
Is installed in the lower and is a quick-opening type door and opens outwards upwards the front of the aircraft

question.title: Question: 160
question.questionText: 1.The escape slide will be automatically deployed if:

answer.answerText: Girt bar attached with escape slide pack and the door is opened
Girt bar is still engaged into floor bracket and the door is opened
Girt bar is still engaged into floor bracket and the door is opened by outside handle

question.title: Question: 161
question.questionText: 2.The function of the safety pin on the pax door is:

answer.answerText: To hold the door when it is closed during whole flight.
To hold the door in the closed position until it is locked
To hold the door in the closed position until it is unlocked

question.title: Question: 162
question.questionText: 3.Landing gear doors can be opened

answer.answerText: Hydraulically on ground only with landing gear selector set to down.
Hydraulically or manually if aircraft is on jack.
Manually on ground only with landing gear selector set to down

question.title: Question: 163
question.questionText: 4.Avionics compartment can be accessed through:

answer.answerText: Avionics lower side of the fuselage.
Avionics door on the fwd cargo compartment.
Access door in the cockpit.

question.title: Question: 164
question.questionText: 5.Emergency exit door of a320 aircraft is equipped

answer.answerText: Slide, which is automatically disarmed when the door is opened from inside.
Slide, which is automatically disarmed when the door is opened from outside.
Slide, which can only be disarmed by release the latch pin from inside.

question.title: Question: 165
question.questionText: 6.The potable water is located at:

answer.answerText: L/H behind the rear cargo compartment.
R/H behind the forward cargo compartment.
R/H behind the rear cargo compartment.

question.title: Question: 166
question.questionText: 7.If the cabin emergency door is opened from outer side with the escape slide in ARMED mode.

answer.answerText: The ARMED mode of the escape slide changes to DISARMED mode as well as passenger door.
The escape slide will deploy.
The door can not be opened

question.title: Question: 167
question.questionText: 8. Where the escape slide pack of cabin emergency door located?

answer.answerText: Holds on the door.
Holds in a container underneath the door.
Holds on the overhead stowage compartment.

question.title: Question: 168
question.questionText: 9.Where the inflation reservoir of the emergency exits door located?

answer.answerText: At the bottom of the door.
In the overhead stowage compartment.
In the AFT cargo compartment.

question.title: Question: 169
question.questionText: 0.The APU can normally be supplied with fuel by:

answer.answerText: Only the APU pump.
Only the LH main pumps.
LH main pumps or APU fuel pump.

question.title: Question: 170
question.questionText: 1.What happen if a high level is detected?

answer.answerText: A warning is triggered: too much fuel.
The corresponding REFUEL valve closes.
All refueling operations are stopped

question.title: Question: 171
question.questionText: 2.Which tanks are the main supply tanks?

answer.answerText: Wing tanks.
Center (transfer) tank.
Outer cells.

question.title: Question: 172
question.questionText: 3.How many valves are used during the draining operation of water system?

answer.answerText: One.
Two.
Three.

question.title: Question: 173
question.questionText: 4.Which cabin emergency exits door can be used as passenger door?

answer.answerText: All emergency exits doors
Two FWD emergency exits doors
Two AFT emergency exits doors
FWD L/H emergency exits doors

question.title: Question: 174
question.questionText: 5.What happen when the emergency exit door of A321 aircraft is opened from the outside and slide system is armed?

answer.answerText: The locking mechanism is blocked
The escape slide will deploy
The slide system is disarmed
There is no possibility to open the door from the outside

question.title: Question: 175
question.questionText: 6.Is it possible to fill the A321 aircraft water tank without electrical supplied?

answer.answerText: Yes, fill/overflow drain valve can operate manually
Yes, but when finished you must manually return the control handle to the NORMAL position to close the fill/overflow drain valve
No, because level transmitter can not send signal to close the fill/overflow drain valve
No, because the fill/overflow drain valve operate electrically

question.title: Question: 176
question.questionText: 7.The APU of A321 aircraft can normally be supplied with the fuel by:

answer.answerText: Only the APU pump
Only the LH main pumps
LH main pumps or APU fuel pump

question.title: Question: 177
question.questionText: 8.The engine anti-ice air overboard discharge grill is located?

answer.answerText: On the outboard side of the inlet cowl.
On the right side fan cowl door.
On the lower right side of the inlet cowl.
At the bottom (5 o’clock position) of fan cowling

question.title: Question: 178
question.questionText: 9.The engine oil servicing panel is located?

answer.answerText: On the outboard side of the inlet cowl.
On the left side fan cowl door.
On the left side of the inlet cowl.
On the left side of the reverser cowl.

question.title: Question: 179
question.questionText: 0.Each reverser cowl:

answer.answerText: Is hold closed by 6 single latches.
Is held open by a single hold open rod
Is held open by two hold open rods.

question.title: Question: 180
question.questionText: 1.When the engine is running:

answer.answerText: No personnel is allowed to get access to the engine.
Access to the engine is permitted within the Entry/Exit corridor if power do not exceed min idle.
Access to the engine is permitted within the Entry/Exit corridor at all power rating.

question.title: Question: 181
question.questionText: 2.The engine run up at Min idle can be carried out with:

answer.answerText: Fan cowls opened and secured
Both Reverser and Fan cowls opened and secured
Thrust Reverser cowls opened and secured
Non engine cowl opened

question.title: Question: 182
question.questionText: 3.Features of CFM-56-5B4 engine are:

answer.answerText: Two spools, axial flow, high fan bypass ratio and mixed exhaust.
Two spools, radial flow, high fan bypass ratio and mixed exhaust.
Two spools, axial flow, high fan bypass ratio and separated exhaust.
Two spools, axial flow, high fan bypass ratio and mixed exhaust.

question.title: Question: 183
question.questionText: 4.Select the correct type of combustion chamber for CFM-56-5B4 engine?

answer.answerText: Annular combustor.
Tubular combustor.
Reverse flow combustor.

question.title: Question: 184
question.questionText: 5.The H.P. Compressor has how many stages?

answer.answerText: Twelve.
Ten.
Nine

question.title: Question: 185
question.questionText: 6.The HP Turbine has how many stages?

answer.answerText: Only one stage.
Four stages
Two stages.

question.title: Question: 186
question.questionText: 7. Identify the number of blades in one engine fan set?

answer.answerText: Thirty six (36)
Twenty two (22)
Thirty two (32)

question.title: Question: 187
question.questionText: 8.The engine gear boxes are driven by which shaft?

answer.answerText: N1 rotor.
N2 rotor via the transfer gear box.
N2 rotor.

question.title: Question: 188
question.questionText: 9.The hand cranking drive connects to?

answer.answerText: LP rotor.
HP rotor.
Both LP and HP rotors.

question.title: Question: 189
question.questionText: 0.Of which type is the ignition system?

answer.answerText: Low voltage, high energy.
High voltage, low energy.
High voltage, high energy.

question.title: Question: 190
question.questionText: 1.What provide the selection of ignition A/B?

answer.answerText: The ECU.
The engine control panel.
The ECAM control panel.

question.title: Question: 191
question.questionText: 2.When the ignition is inhibited?

answer.answerText: During automatic start when N2 is above 16%.
During dry crank sequence.
During wet crank sequence.
During wet and dry crank sequences.

question.title: Question: 192
question.questionText: 3.Each engine equipped with?

answer.answerText: One ignition system with two igniters.
Two ignition systems, each has two igniters.
Two ignition systems with two igniters.

question.title: Question: 193
question.questionText: 4.Ignition system power supply is?

answer.answerText: 115 V from the aircraft.
115 V from engine generator.
28 V from the FADEC PMA

question.title: Question: 194
question.questionText: 5.What does Continuous Relight mean?

answer.answerText: An active ignition system will work continuously.
Both ignition systems are selected during engine start.
Both ignition systems are demanded to work continuously.

question.title: Question: 195
question.questionText: 6.Is the purpose of the Active Clearance Control (ACC) system?

answer.answerText: To improve compressor efficiency
To improve and maintain engine performance
To reduce overall engine thermal growth

question.title: Question: 196
question.questionText: 7.What is used to cool the ECU?

answer.answerText: Ram air taken from dedicated air intake scoop.
Fan air taken from dedicated air intake scoop.
Fan air taken from nacelle cooling system.

question.title: Question: 197
question.questionText: 8.What is used to cool the fan and core compartments?

answer.answerText: Ram air for both compartments
Fan air for both compartments.
Ram air for fan compartment and Fan air for core compartment.

question.title: Question: 198
question.questionText: 9.The engine primary parameters are displayed on?

answer.answerText: The lower ECAM engine page.
The upper ECAM.
Both The lower ECAM engine page and the upper ECAM.

question.title: Question: 199
question.questionText: 0.The engine page is selected?

answer.answerText: Manually or automatically depend on flight phases.
Manually only.
Automatically only depend on flight phases.

question.title: Question: 200
question.questionText: 1.The engine vibration parameter is displayed on?

answer.answerText: The Upper ECAM.
The Lower ECAM engine page.
The Lower ECAM engine page or Cruise page.

question.title: Question: 201
question.questionText: 2.The engine oil quantity parameters are displayed on?

answer.answerText: The Upper ECAM.
The Lower ECAM engine page.
The Lower ECAM engine page or Cruise page.

question.title: Question: 202
question.questionText: 3.The engine oil pressure parameters are displayed on?

answer.answerText: The Upper ECAM.
The Lower ECAM engine page.
The Lower ECAM engine page or Cruise page.

question.title: Question: 203
question.questionText: 4.The fuel used indication is reset to Zero :

answer.answerText: Five minutes after engine shut down
After a new take-off
Through the MCDU
At each engine start

question.title: Question: 204
question.questionText: 5.The engine thrust indicated on ECAM via what parameter?

answer.answerText: N1 speed
N2 speed
EGT

question.title: Question: 205
question.questionText: 6.Which important safety procedure should be performed before any maintenance work on or near the ‘C’ ducts or reverser system?

answer.answerText: Unlock and pin the actuators.
Lock out the translating sleeves.
Deactivate and pin the lever on the HCU.
Deactivate and pin the lever on the HCU and lock out translating sleeves.

question.title: Question: 206
question.questionText: 7.The oil tank content can be checked by?

answer.answerText: Opening a dedicated servicing access panel in the LH fan cowl.
Opening an access panel on the LH “C’ duct.
Opening the RH fan cowl

question.title: Question: 207
question.questionText: 8.How is the main cooling of the oil system achieved?

answer.answerText: By an air-cooled oil cooler.
By a fuel cooled oil cooler in the HP fuel system.
By a fuel cooled oil cooler in the LP fuel system.

question.title: Question: 208
question.questionText: 9.Engine oil MCD is on?

answer.answerText: The oil supply circuit.
The oil scavenge circuit.
The oil ventilation circuit.

question.title: Question: 209
question.questionText: 0.Engine oil temperature indication is measured on?

answer.answerText: The oil supply circuit.
The oil scavenge circuit.
The oil ventilation circuit.

question.title: Question: 210
question.questionText: 1.How can you assure that the oil servicing of starter is accomplished?

answer.answerText: Checking the engine oil sign glass.
Check ECAM indication.
Check the oil flows though the overflow port.

question.title: Question: 211
question.questionText: 2.What is the best wind direction for engine STARTING?

answer.answerText: Side wind
Tail wind
Front wind

question.title: Question: 212
question.questionText: 3.Features of V2530-A5 engine are:

answer.answerText: Two spools, axial flow, annular combustor and mixed exhaust.
Two spools, radial flow, annular combustor and mixed exhaust.
Two spools, axial flow, annular combustor and separated exhaust.
Two spools, axial flow, tubular combustor and mixed exhaust.
Engine is rated at max thrust of 25300 lbs to install in the Airbus A/C
Engine is rated at max thrust of 30000 lbs to install in the Airbus A/C
Engine is rated at max thrust of 25000 lbs to install in the Airbus A/C

question.title: Question: 214
question.questionText: 5.The engine exhaust directs rearwards?

answer.answerText: Fan air discharge.
Engine core exhaust.
Both fan air discharge and the engine core exhaust.

question.title: Question: 215
question.questionText: 6.Reverser cowling:

answer.answerText: Is attached to the engine core by 6 hinges each half.
Is hold closed by 5 single latches.
Should be opened/closed using the Auxiliary latch assembly.

question.title: Question: 216
question.questionText: 7.Each half of reverser cowl c duct:

answer.answerText: Is held closed by 4 latches.
Is held open by a single hold open rod
Is held open by two hold open rods.

question.title: Question: 217
question.questionText: 8.Fan cowls:

answer.answerText: Must be held open by both struts each when the wind is more than 26 knots (30 mph).
Should be opened by releasing 6 latches in sequence from the front to the rear.
Must always be held open by both struts each.

question.title: Question: 218
question.questionText: 9.The H.P. Compressor has how many stages?

answer.answerText: Twelve.
Ten.
Fourteen.

question.title: Question: 219
question.questionText: 0.Identify the number of blades in one engine fan set?

answer.answerText: Thirty three (33)
Twenty two (22)
Thirty two (32)

question.title: Question: 220
question.questionText: 1.What statement is NOT correct?

answer.answerText: Fan stage has 22 fan blades.
Fan stage has 24 fan blades.
Engine is constructed by 05 modules.
Gearboxes are driven by HP shaft.

question.title: Question: 221
question.questionText: 2.The air starter valve access panel is on?

answer.answerText: RH fan cowl.
LH fan cowl
RH reverser cowl.
Out board fan cowl.

question.title: Question: 222
question.questionText: 3.Has the oil pressure filter a pop out indicator fitted?

answer.answerText: Yes.
No.
There is no pressure filter in the system.

question.title: Question: 223
question.questionText: 4.Which filters in the oil system have associated “filter clog” messages on the ECAM?

answer.answerText: Pressure Scavenge and Scavenge strainers.
Pressure only.
Scavenge only.

question.title: Question: 224
question.questionText: 5.Which normal indications are displayed on the ECAM for the oil system?

answer.answerText: Oil differential pressure, oil temperature, oil tank quantity.
Oil temperature, oil pressure.
Oil differential pressure, oil quantity,

question.title: Question: 225
question.questionText: 6.What does the HMS heat and cool?

answer.answerText: Fuel, engine oil and IDG oil.
Engine oil and IDG oil.
Fuel only.
Fuel and engine oil.

question.title: Question: 226
question.questionText: 7.How the Nose Cone (Spinner) is anti-iced?

answer.answerText: Electrically.
Pneumatically.
Neither electrically nor pneumatically.
Not required

question.title: Question: 227
question.questionText: 8.In normal T/R operation, actuator unlocked condition is indicated by?

answer.answerText: REV in green appears inside the EPR gauge.
REV in amber appears inside the N1 gauge.
REV in amber appears inside the EPR gauge.

question.title: Question: 228
question.questionText: 9.Fuel samples can be taken from?

answer.answerText: The LP fuel filter cover.
The LP fuel pump case.
The HP fuel pump outlet.

question.title: Question: 229
question.questionText: 0.Which engine parameters are displayed on the ECAM upper display?

answer.answerText: EPR, N1 & N2.
N1, N2, EPR, oil pressure, oil temperature.
N1, N2, EPR & EGT.
